The Investment Operations Department is in charge of originating, structuring and monitoring IDB Invest’s transactions. The Department is comprised of three divisions responsible for originating and structuring transactions in each of IDB Invest’s priority industries: (i) Infrastructure and Energy, (ii) Corporates and (iii) Financial Intermediaries, and two transversal divisions responsible for (i) Financial Products and Services and (ii) Portfolio Management.

We are currently searching a dynamic professional to support the Portfolio Management Division in monitoring, from signature to repayment, a portfolio of loans and guarantees to private sector and non-sovereign guarantee counterparts in our three priority industries and/or transversal equity/mezzanine transactions. Specific placement of the consultants will be decided according to their relevant experience and education.

What You’ll Do

Support Portfolio Management Officers in:

Overseeing a portfolio of loan/ guarantee and/or equity transactions.
Obtaining and analyzing information to assess counterparty performance, and compliance with financing agreements, and to mitigate risk.
Conducting financial statement analysis, analyzing financial projections, preparing risk rating proposals and periodic supervision reports to assess the credit standing of our counterparts.
Assessing status/events affecting loans/ guarantees and equity, and, where necessary, disseminating information/preparing recommendations for appropriate action.
Engaging with borrowers, shareholders, B-lenders co-lenders, co-investors as well as agents and internal counterparts.
Participating in client monitoring meetings and Investment Committees (when candidates are assigned to equity transactions).
Following ongoing developments in the relevant industry sector(s).
Ensuring that counterparts comply with IDB Invest internal risk policies and guidelines, liaising closely with the credit risk management, environmental and social, legal and finance departments, among others.
Participating in activities that support inclusiveness (mentoring, recruitment, leadership development, on-boarding, etc.).
Proposing and supporting actions to improve and streamline internal processes.
Contributing to the development and assessment of developmental effectiveness indicators.
Collecting and disseminating loan/guarantee/equity credit/equity risk information.
Providing support to the Portfolio Management Division and the Investment Operations Department in all other tasks required.

You have a clear understanding of the operational work of IDB Invest or similar multilateral institution. Sector knowledge in the industries in which we operate as well as experience in an international environment, preferably in Latin America and the Caribbean. Education: bachelor’s degree (or equivalent advanced degree) in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Law, Engineering, Development Studies, or relevant field. Master’s degree (or MBA) will be considered a plus.
Experience: Between two (2) and four (4) years of experience in the credit assessment and/or rating of corporate and/or project finance counterparts, gained within a bank, financial institution and/or rating agency.
Languages: Proficiency in Spanish and English, spoken and written, is required

Learn continuously.

Collaborate and share knowledge.
Focus on clients.
Communicate and influence.
Innovate and try new things.

The IDB Group, composed of the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), IDB Invest, and the IDB Lab offers flexible financing solutions to its member countries to finance economic and social development through lending and grants to public and private entities in Latin America and the Caribbean.

We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Investment Restrictions Manager

Role Purpose

AMGB has implemented a global target operating model around Investment Restrictions. This delivers global ownership and oversight, a central team of Investment Restrictions Experts and a strong governance framework within the Global Network Markets.

The role is a member of the GSC in Mexico to near shore support the local Investment Restrictions team based in the US and is responsible for investment restriction interpretation, coding, approval, monitoring and uplifting activities.

The role has specific focus on regulatory and investment compliance related tasks.

In addition, the role participates in change driven project work to support the implementation and maintenance of the target operating model on an ongoing basis.

Principal Accountabilities

Work in a team of Investment Restrictions specialists located within AMUS. The team is responsible for restrictions management including coding and testing of rules on Bloomberg AIM as well as pre- and post trade monitoring.

Participate in change driven project work to support the implementation and maintenance of the target operating model on an ongoing basis.

Support the development of a strong governance framework around Investment Restrictions on a global basis including the production of Management information (MI) , and the definition and maintenance of best practices.

Work closely with and provide expertise to key stakeholders from the business lines and functions within AM (e.g. Front Office, Product, Risk, Compliance, Data Management, IT).

Other Ad Hoc Activities As Required By The Business

Foster client relationships at industry events

Other Ad Hoc Activities As Required By The Business

Ensure quality and consistency of centrally managed Investment Restrictions especially with regards to coding and testing of rules.

Support the delivery of suitable MI and input for better STP processes to all business lines and functions affected (Risk, Compliance, Front Office, Product, Data, IT, etc.).

Drive the reinforcement of skills of the Investment Restrictions staff due to knowledge sharing and definition of best practices

Build a clear, easy to use best practice library on coding and testing of Investment Restrictions.

Deliver ongoing improvements with process driven solutions

Manage delivery of services to Asset Management FIM, SLA’s and continuity/DR modelling

Requirements

Demonstrates courageous integrity and ability to challenge existing and new practices.

The role requires an individual who is goal orientated, commercially minded, customer and results focused.

Proven ability to work accurately within tight timescales and interact well within a team environment.

Self starter with proven ability to work collaboratively within a team and who can influence and motivate people around them.

Good written/verbal communication skills (English Language!).

Ability to clearly articulate concepts and issues, manage/interpret the deliverables, and translate theory into practical business solutions.

Detail oriented and able to prioritise multiple projects and/or tasks.

Experience

Ability to lead small focused projects

Good analytical skills with advanced MS suite (Excel, Access, Powerpoint, Visio) and data manipulation skills required

Confidence and track record in building solid working relationships with key stakeholders, securing project resources or priorities from them through persuasion and influence.

University graduate with more than 3 years of industry experience.

System skills: Bloomberg AIM welcome

Good knowledge of Investment Restrictions, more than 2 years of experience required.

Good knowledge of respective local and international regulatory requirements (US1940 Act, UCITS, AIFMD, CESR/10-788, etc.).

Good knowledge of fund contracts / IMAs, prospectuses and other relevant mandate specific documentation.

Track record of guidelines negotiation and practical rule translation, coding and testing.

Job Description

This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic and experienced individual to make an impact in this new role. We are currently looking for an experienced Associate to join the **Onboarding** Team in Mexico City, as a member of the Manager Onboarding sub-function. This team supports the Global WTW Delegated Investment Solutions (DIS) business (also referred to as OCIO or Outsourced Chief Investment Officer services), with a focus on institutional clients in North American and EMEA and is part of a wider Global Investment Operations group of around 220 colleagues.

This role’s key responsibilities will be to complete the necessary tasks to onboard new managers and underlying funds to our trading platform, while supporting the account opening process for these funds to be included in our target portfolios for existing clients. The Investment Operations Associate will coordinate legal negotiations with internal and external legal counsel, legal and investment review activities to assist in the review, completion, and execution of contracts/fund documents, and maintain client and fund documentation as it relates specifically to the assets.

As a member of the Manager Onboarding Team (within the larger Operations Team), you will initiate efficient processes for reviewing and implementing agreements on behalf of our institutional pension clients. The role requires the ability to collaborate on cross-functional teams with colleagues from all levels, while effectively communicating opinions and ideas in a succinct and coherent manner.

As an experienced professional, the Associate will promote industry best practices, a desire for operational accuracy and exceptional client service.

At WTW we value personal development and will facilitate training to ensure you maintain and strengthen your technical knowledge and skillset.

The Role

The role specializes in the onboarding of new investment managers (New Manager Onboarding), in the investment into new and existing investment manager, by our institutional clients, and responding to various manager queries. The role works closely with Trade Management and Client Onboarding in all aspects of the below.

New Investment Managers

Coordinate the Manager Onboarding tasks for investments new to WTW, including liaising with legal counsel, Portfolio Management, Compliance, Client Onboarding, Trade Management and Middle Office.
Liaise with legal counsel to obtain advice, coordinate legal opinions on new assets, and ensure completion of legal documents where required e.g. Legal side letters.
Complete sections of subscription documents and other supporting documents, on behalf of our clients, related to the Manager Onboarding function, including tax and legal status.

New + Existing Client Assets

Support transitioning client assets to new investments, within the stated requirements and deadlines. This includes coordinating and completing sections of the funds’ subscription documents and other supporting documents related to the Manager onboarding function.
Source and collate supporting client governance documentation required for account opening, such as Trust agreements, W-8BEN-Es[AF1] and sensitive client information such as Senior Manager Official information.
Assist with other projects such as completing any necessary manager forms and sourcing any documentation required for portfolio restructuring, Master Trust closures and plan name changes,
Respond to ad hoc manager queries, including obtaining any necessary information for such response.

General

Support and encourage healthy collaboration with key internal stakeholders, including Middle Office, Portfolio Management, Trade Management, Client and Manager Onboarding, Client Consulting, and the Global Operations team.
Identify and mitigate risks by implementing process improvements.
Identify process efficiencies and implement improvements.
Keep procedure documents up to date, constantly monitoring for required amendments.
Encourage a culture of accountability with adherence to relevant compliance, risk management and error policies.
Supporting Operational Transformation
As a member of a wider team, Global Investment Operations, support the evolution of the Canadian business to the Global Operations Model. Confidently articulate ideas for process improvement. You will be encouraged to question the status quo, and lead efficiency projects to improve global Manager Onboarding practices.

Qualifications

Duties and Responsibilities:

Incorporate key details in the preparation of agreements, and related documentation pertaining to investing the assets of retirement plans with investment managers.
Review client documents (including plan documents, trust agreements, investment policies) as it relates to the AML (anti-money laundering)/KYC (know your customer) process.
Effectively communicate with fund managers, custodians, and other external parties involved to ensure all agree on a trade timeline.
Learn about the wider investment consulting business by gaining exposure to numerous facets of the industry and have opportunities to work with multiple different teams within the organization.
Develop collaborative relationships and openly communicate on work matters with internal teams.
Effectively interact with internal teams to keep them informed on progress and ensure they carry out any required actions.

The Requirements

A minimum of 1-3 years of successful investment industry experience
Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to monitor and manage multiple tasks often within short timeframes. Project management experience is an asset.
A keen eye and attention to detail.
Knowledge/experience of investment manager agreements and fund subscription documents.
Expectation of being able to act proactively and independently.
Strong oral and written communication skills. English is required. French is an asset.
Ability to build strong networks internally and to collaborate effectively on cross-functional teams.
Natural ease and effectiveness when dealing with clients/colleagues at all levels.
Demonstrated understanding of the Canadian financial regulatory environment is an asset.
Undergraduate degree with a quantitative emphasis such as majors in Business, Math, Finance, Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience with professional certifications
A proven interest in finance and investments, demonstrating a curiosity to continue to learn and grow as the industry changes. An understanding of institutional clients is an asset.
You align with WTW values of Client Focus, Teamwork, Integrity and Excellence. We value inclusivity, respect, and diversity.

Role is located in Mexico City. We offer a flexible work environment and currently have at least two anchor days per week where the team is expected to work from the office.

Details:
Conservation International protects nature for the benefit of humanity. Through science, policy, fieldwork, and finance, we spotlight and secure the most important places in nature for the climate, biodiversity, and for people. With offices in 30 countries and projects in more than 100 countries, Conservation International partners with governments, companies, civil society, Indigenous peoples, and local communities to help people and nature thrive together.

POSITION SUMMARY - This position could be based in Bogota-Colombia, Rio de Janeiro - Brazil, Mexico City – Mexico, Capetown - South Africa or Remote possible.

As a core component of its Climate Strategy, Conservation International has set ambitious targets for scaling restoration globally as a climate solution. The Restoration Delivery Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Manager will develop and oversee a robust M&E framework to track, analyze, and report on the rapidly growing stream of restoration projects across different restoration strategies and provide the resources for CI to adaptively manage its rapidly scaling global restoration portfolios. This work will position CI as a thought leader and partner of choice in nuanced, data-driven, tailored, cost-effective restoration and contribute key knowledge to the global ecosystem restoration community derived from CI’s restoration portfolio.

The Restoration Delivery M&E Manager reports directly to the Restoration Partnerships Director in the Center for Natural Climate Solutions and collaborates closely with the Global Restoration Lead, the Restoration Science Director, the Restoration Economy and Finance Director, the Restoration Monitoring Manager, and finance, awards and operations staff, as well as internal and external thought leaders. To be successful, the Restoration Delivery M&E Manager needs demonstrable experience in developing and overseeing M&E frameworks for complex international programs, covering an array of themes, including policy, finance, ecosystem restoration, and others. They must be comfortable working with multiple collaborators simultaneously, as well as capturing and integrating metrics on stakeholder engagement, gender, IP&LCs, and others and ensuring that the M&E framework actively supports adaptive management of the program and successfully informs CI’s strategy for implementing restoration at scale through data-driven implementation worldwide.

Responsibilities

The Restoration Delivery M&E Manager is responsible for the delivery of Monitoring and Evaluation for Ecosystem Restoration, including:

The development, implementation, and reporting of the M&E Plan for a large multi-country portfolio, including gathering all relevant data, preparing necessary reports, overseeing external evaluations, and other activities that may be required. This will include , among others, the completion of the Program level Results Framework and the Program level tracking tool. The completion of the latter will require gathering data from key IP Program partners to assess the direct and indirect environmental benefits of the partnership work and reporting.
Oversee and advise on the support to be provided to resource assessment, monitoring, evaluation, and impact assessment, at project and program levels. This will contribute to optimizing adaptive management and impact delivery at these levels, and to establishing the bases for scaling out of program results.

Key Functions

Project management

Support and inform, in close collaboration with the Global Coordination Unit (GCU) and country project teams, on the M&E system for the integrated program as a whole and its Global Coordination Project (GCP), including finalizing the formulation of programmatic indicators that are compatible with country project indicators and the application of their results in support of adaptive management.
Identify and develop M&E methodologies, plans, and tools necessary to support project and program-level tracking.
Support the evaluation of the overall program impact assessment and the GCP assessment.
Provide periodic quarterly reports and assessments on progress against goals for internal and external audiences, including quarterly and annual M&E reports for submission to CI-GEF and GEF.
Support data management, collection, and standardization across the program, acting as a focal point for data requests.

Capacity building

Advise and support country project teams on the formulation and implementation of their project-level M&E systems, including harmonized methodological guidance for M&E knowledge collation and management, the identification and application of tools for M&E and resource assessment at field, community, and landscape levels, and the fine-tuning of indicators required to ensure their relevance and, where needed, their compatibility with GCP/IP indicators.
Review and advise country projects on the application of M&E in adaptive management.
Support project management capacity-building efforts, contributing to identifying, developing, and delivering high-quality technical products that aim to help CI staff and partners improve their project management capabilities. This includes a focus on refining and delivering M&E training.
Support and inform the refinement of institutional indicators and key project- and program-level indicators as necessary.

Knowledge management and exchange

Contribute to knowledge management and exchange activities to ensure that all information and products developed by the program is made available to relevant stakeholders to promote best practice in ecosystem restoration, including robust M&E practices.
Lead technical exchanges and coordination with key project/Integrated Program partners on methodologies and tools for M&E, assessment, and information management, in order to ensure that the project is applying best practice.
Present M&E framework and results to internal and external audiences as needed.

Other duties as assigned by supervisor.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Frequent travel to project sites and to international meetings.
Ability to work extended work hours to meet project deadlines.
Guidance on flexible work arrangements will be shared during the interview process.
